intro: Acer italum var. opulifolium, commonly known as the Italian maple, is a deciduous tree native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its finely toothed, ovate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras for seed dispersal. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and parks.
